H0.text: To insulate the electrical wire is the best explanation for why electrical wires are usually covered with plastic or rubber.

H1.text: To keep the electrical wire warm is the best explanation for why electrical wires are usually covered with plastic or rubber.

H2.text: To make the electrical wire stronger is the best explanation for why electrical wires are usually covered with plastic or rubber.

H3.text: To make the electrical wire more flexible is the best explanation for why electrical wires are usually covered with plastic or rubber.

A4.text: Flexible insulating materials such as PVC (polyvinyl chloride) are used to insulate the circuit and prevent human contact with a 'live' wire â€“ one having voltage of 600 volts or less.

A5.text: Insulators are used in electrical equipment to support and separate electrical conductors without allowing current through themselves.
